mortality.note: Most deaths from starvation during Nigerian blockade. Images of starving Biafran children shocked the world. Federal policy: 'Starvation is a legitimate weapon of war.' UK and Soviet Union backed Nigeria; France backed Biafra.

rationales.systematic_intensity: Nigerian blockade, deliberate starvation strategy. International relief obstructed.
rationales.profit: Oil resources in Biafra region. Economic interests in keeping Nigeria unified.
rationales.ideology: Ethnic tensions (Igbo secession) but primarily political and economic.
rationales.complicity: Nigeria, Britain, Soviet Union supported blockade. International community slow to respond.

analysis.pattern_note: First televised famine - starving children broadcast globally. Biafra (Igbo-majority) seceded; Nigeria blockaded. Oil was the prize - Biafra had major reserves. UK backed Nigeria despite famine images. Coined term 'humanitarian intervention' as international response. Nigeria won; reintegration followed. Some call it genocide; Nigeria calls it civil war.
